metadata.title: CVE-2023-52425 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
libexpat through 2.5.0 allows a denial of service (resource consumption)because many full reparsings are required in the case of a large token forwhich multiple buffer fills are needed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52425` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.7-1ubuntu0.3
libexpat1 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu0.3').
xmlrpc-c package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
insighttoolkit4 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
gdcm package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
coin3 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
libxmltok: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'changes too intrusive').
